Several.definition: of or relating separately to each individual involved ;specif
Several.origin: [Anglo-French, from Medieval Latin separalis , from Latin separ separate]

1 a.definition: of or relating separately to each individual involvedenforceable separately against each party [each promisor owed a duty] see alsoatat

sub_terms.b: being separately or individually responsible, liable, or obligated [a obligor] compare

2.definition: separate or distinct from one another [to regulate commerce with foreign nations and among the States "art. I"]
